Header: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry arrives
Content: US Secretary of State John Kerry arrived in Sri Lanka on Saturday, May 2 morning on a two day official visit. Our correspondent said the US Secretary of State landed at the Bandaranaike International Airport at 7:50 this morning. The delegation was welcomed by Sri Lankaâ€™s Foreign Minister, Mangala Samaraweera. Kerry is scheduled to hold bi-lateral discussions with Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera at the Foreign Ministry this morning. The Foreign Ministry stated that this is the first official visit by a US Secretary of State since 1972, when Secretary Pierce Rogers visited the country. Meanwhile in 2005, Colin Powell visited Sri lanka to assess the damage caused by the Tsunami. Kerry is also set to hold discussion with President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. The US State Department said that it is hoped that through these discussion peace and stability will be achieved in the country. During his visit, the US Secretary of State will also participate in Vesak celebrations.
